items.title: Trump and Mamdani form an unlikely alliance at White House meeting
items.standfirst: ‘We agreed a lot more than I would have thought,’ the US president said of his first face-to-face meeting with the New York mayor-electUS politics live – latest updatesDonald Trump and Zohran Mamdani, the New York City mayor-elect, walked out of their meeting on Friday afternoon with an unlikely alliance, agreeing to work together on housing, food prices and cost-of-living concerns that have defined both their political appeals to working-class voters.“We agreed a lot more than I would have thought,” Trump said in the Oval Office, sometimes jumping in to shield Mamdani from aggressive questioning from the press. Continue reading...

items.title: Zelenskyy says Ukraine has impossible choice as Trump pushes plan to end war
items.standfirst: US president demands that Kyiv accepts plan that would mean giving up territory to RussiaVolodymyr Zelenskyy has said Ukraine faces one of the most difficult moments in its history, after Donald Trump demanded Kyiv accepts within days a US-backed “peace plan” that would force it to give up territory to Russia and make other painful concessions.Trump confirmed on Friday morning that next Thursday – Thanksgiving in the US – would be an “acceptable” deadline for Zelenskyy to sign the deal, which European and Ukrainian officials have said amounts to a “capitulation”. Continue reading...
items.content: US president demands that Kyiv accepts plan that would mean giving up territory to RussiaVolodymyr Zelenskyy has said Ukraine faces one of the most difficult moments in its history, after Donald Trump demanded Kyiv accepts within days a US-backed “peace plan” that would force it to give up territory to Russia and make other painful concessions.Trump confirmed on Friday morning that next Thursday – Thanksgiving in the US – would be an “acceptable” deadline for Zelenskyy to sign the deal, which European and Ukrainian officials have said amounts to a “capitulation”. Continue reading...

items.title: How key players reacted to US plan to end war in Ukraine
items.standfirst: European leaders and UN officials voiced unease on Friday over a new US proposal to end the war in Ukraine, warning that Washington’s plan risked sidelining Kyiv and its allies. The 28-point plan calls for major concessions by Ukraine, including giving up a part of its eastern territory.
items.content: European leaders and UN officials voiced unease on Friday over a new US proposal to end the war in Ukraine, warning that Washington’s plan risked sidelining Kyiv and its allies. The 28-point plan calls for major concessions by Ukraine, including giving up a part of its eastern territory.

items.title: Volodymyr Zelensky faces an impossible dilemma for Ukraine
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky is being pushed into a stark dilemma: accept the controversial US-backed peace plan — widely seen as overwhelmingly favourable to Russia — or risk being accused of rejecting peace and undermining Washington’s diplomatic efforts. President Donald Trump is now increasing pressure on Zelensky to endorse the proposal, leaving Kyiv with little room to manoeuvre, as FRANCE 24's Gulliver Cragg explains from Kyiv.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky is being pushed into a stark dilemma: accept the controversial US-backed peace plan — widely seen as overwhelmingly favourable to Russia — or risk being accused of rejecting peace and undermining Washington’s diplomatic efforts. President Donald Trump is now increasing pressure on Zelensky to endorse the proposal, leaving Kyiv with little room to manoeuvre, as FRANCE 24's Gulliver Cragg explains from Kyiv.

items.title: The stakes behind Zohran Mamdani and Donald Trump’s first face-to-face
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump is about to meet New York mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani on Friday, their first face-to-face after trading insults for weeks. Mamdani requested the meeting to discuss living costs and public safety, while Trump has threatened to cut federal funding to the city and branded the 34-year-old democratic socialist a 'radical left lunatic'. FRANCE 24's international editor Douglas Herbert analyses the stakes of this first meeting.
items.content: President Donald Trump is about to meet New York mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani on Friday, their first face-to-face after trading insults for weeks. Mamdani requested the meeting to discuss living costs and public safety, while Trump has threatened to cut federal funding to the city and branded the 34-year-old democratic socialist a 'radical left lunatic'. FRANCE 24's international editor Douglas Herbert analyses the stakes of this first meeting.

items.title: Ukraine risks ‘losing a key partner’ with Trump’s peace proposal, Zelensky says
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said Friday that he would not betray Ukraine's interests in a US-led peace process, warning that Kyiv faces a choice between safeguarding its dignity and risking a rupture with Washington. The 28-point plan the United States presented to Kyiv was laden with Russian demands, including Ukrainian territorial concessions.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said Friday that he would not betray Ukraine's interests in a US-led peace process, warning that Kyiv faces a choice between safeguarding its dignity and risking a rupture with Washington. The 28-point plan the United States presented to Kyiv was laden with Russian demands, including Ukrainian territorial concessions.

items.standfirst: Ukraine's president says country risks 'losing dignity or a major partner' as US plan offers key concessions to Russia.
items.content: Ukraine's president says country risks 'losing dignity or a major partner' as US plan offers key concessions to Russia.

items.title: CDC claims vaccines may cause autism. And, Trump and Mamdani to meet today
items.standfirst: The CDC claims, without evidence, that vaccines may cause autism. And, New York City mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani heads to the White House, where he will meet the president for the first time.
items.content: The CDC claims, without evidence, that vaccines may cause autism. And, New York City mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani heads to the White House, where he will meet the president for the first time.(Image credit: Elijah Nouvelage)

items.title: White House urges Ukraine to accept peace plan as Zelenskyy weighs repercussions
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump said Friday that he wants Ukraine to accept a new peace deal by Thanksgiving, after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned the deal was forcing his country to choose between its “dignity” and a “key partner.”The White House wants Kyiv to sign off on a “framework” to end the war in Ukraine based upon the U.S.-crafted 28-point peace plan by Thursday, according to three U.S. officials
items.content: President Donald Trump said Friday that he wants Ukraine to accept a new peace deal by Thanksgiving, after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned the deal was forcing his country to choose between its “dignity” and a “key partner.”The White House wants Kyiv to sign off on a “framework” to end the war in Ukraine based upon the U.S.-crafted 28-point peace plan by Thursday, according to three U.S. officials

ai_summary: Donald Trump and New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani met at the White House on Friday.
Trump praised Mamdani, saying he would be a "great mayor" and they agreed on many things.
Former Mayor Bill de Blasio said Mamdani "did the smart thing" by meeting with Trump.
The meeting was described as productive, with both men speaking positively about each other.
Trump expressed confidence in Mamdani's ability to do a "very good job" as mayor.

The Indian Air Force said an investigation is starting. The plane, India’s only current domestically developed fighter, crashed during a display scheduled to start at…

items.title: Fighter jet pilot killed in Dubai Air Show crash
items.standfirst: The pilot of an Indian Air Force fighter jet was killed when his plane crashed and burst into flames on the final day of the Dubai Air Show.
items.content: The pilot of an Indian Air Force fighter jet was killed when his plane crashed and burst into flames on the final day of the Dubai Air Show.

items.title: Pilot killed as fighter jet crashes at Dubai Airshow

items.content: An Indian-made HAL Tejas fighter jet crashed during a demonstration at the Dubai Airshow in United Arab Emirates.

items.title: India’s Tejas fighter jet crashes at Dubai Airshow, pilot dies
items.standfirst: The crash is the second recorded for the HAL Tejas, a key jet in India's efforts to modernise its air force fleet.
items.content: The crash is the second recorded for the HAL Tejas, a key jet in India's efforts to modernise its air force fleet.

items.title: Plane crashes at Dubai air show
items.standfirst: An Indian jet fighter crashed during a demonstration flight in front of a crowd of spectators at the Dubai Air Show.
items.content: An Indian jet fighter crashed during a demonstration flight in front of a crowd of spectators at the Dubai Air Show.

ai_summary: An Indian-made Tejas fighter jet crashed during a demonstration at the Dubai Airshow.
The pilot of the jet was killed in the crash, which occurred on the final day.
The crash is under investigation by the Indian Air Force.
The Tejas is India's only domestically developed fighter jet currently in use.
This is the second recorded crash of the HAL Tejas fighter jet.

items.content: NPR's Leila Fadel asks Democratic Congressman and former Army Ranger Jason Crow for his response to President Trump after Crow participated in a video urging U.S. troops to refuse illegal orders.(Image credit: OLIVER CONTRERAS/AFP via Getty Images)

ai_summary: President Trump criticized Democratic lawmakers who released a video.
The video urged the military to refuse illegal orders.
Rep. Jason Crow said he is receiving death threats after Trump's comments.
Crow responded to Trump's comments, stating he would not be intimidated.
Retired Rear Admiral Mark Montgomery offered his perspective on the situation.

clusters.title: Eleven injured after grizzly bear attacks schoolchildren and teachers in Canada
clusters.neutral_headline: Grizzly Bear Attacks Schoolchildren in Canada

items.title: Eleven injured after grizzly bear attacks schoolchildren and teachers in Canada
items.standfirst: Two critically hurt after attack on walking trail in British Columbia as police and conservation officers search for bearEleven people were injured, two of them critically, when a grizzly bear attacked a group of schoolchildren and teachers on a walking trail in British Columbia, Canada.The attack happened on Thursday in Bella Coola, 435 miles (700km) north-west of Vancouver. The Nuxalk Nation said the “aggressive bear” remained on the loose and police and conservation officers were on the scene. Continue reading...
items.content: Two critically hurt after attack on walking trail in British Columbia as police and conservation officers search for bearEleven people were injured, two of them critically, when a grizzly bear attacked a group of schoolchildren and teachers on a walking trail in British Columbia, Canada.The attack happened on Thursday in Bella Coola, 435 miles (700km) north-west of Vancouver. The Nuxalk Nation said the “aggressive bear” remained on the loose and police and conservation officers were on the scene. Continue reading...

items.title: Grizzly bear on loose after attacking school group in Canada, injuring 11
items.standfirst: A male teacher "got the whole brunt" of the attack and some children were hit with bear spray.
items.content: A male teacher "got the whole brunt" of the attack and some children were hit with bear spray.

items.title: Two critically injured after grizzly bear attacks schoolchildren
items.standfirst: A grizzly bear attack on a group of schoolchildren and teachers in Canada has injured 11 people, two of them critically.
items.content: A grizzly bear attack on a group of schoolchildren and teachers in Canada has injured 11 people, two of them critically.

ai_summary: A grizzly bear attacked a group of schoolchildren and teachers in British Columbia, Canada.
Eleven people were injured in the attack, with two critically injured.
The attack occurred on a walking trail near Bella Coola.
Police and conservation officers are searching for the bear.
The Nuxalk Nation reported the bear as aggressive and still at large.

clusters.title: We could all pay if Europe doesn't step up and guarantee Ukraine's security in face of US betrayal
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump's 28-point Ukraine plan in full: What it means, could it work?

items.title: We could all pay if Europe doesn't step up and guarantee Ukraine's security in face of US betrayal
items.standfirst: The Donald Trump peace plan is nothing of the sort. It takes Russian demands and presents them as peace proposals, in what is effectively for Ukraine a surrender ultimatum.
items.content: The Donald Trump peace plan is nothing of the sort. It takes Russian demands and presents them as peace proposals, in what is effectively for Ukraine a surrender ultimatum.

items.title: Territorial concessions by Ukraine, a capped army and security guarantees: What's in Trump's draft plan
items.standfirst: Ripples of alarm were coursing from Kyiv through Europe, as details emerged of President Donald Trump’s 28-point peace plan for Russia and Ukraine.
items.content: Ripples of alarm were coursing from Kyiv through Europe, as details emerged of President Donald Trump’s 28-point peace plan for Russia and Ukraine.

items.title: Trump’s 28-point Ukraine plan in full: What it means, could it work?
items.standfirst: The US-brokered proposal requires Kyiv to make territorial concessions to Russia and to stay out of NATO.
items.content: The US-brokered proposal requires Kyiv to make territorial concessions to Russia and to stay out of NATO.

items.title: Trump's 28-point Ukraine peace plan in full
items.standfirst: Donald Trump's plan for ending the war in Ukraine would hand swathes of land to Russia and limit the size of Kyiv's military, a draft has revealed.
items.content: Donald Trump's plan for ending the war in Ukraine would hand swathes of land to Russia and limit the size of Kyiv's military, a draft has revealed.

ai_summary: Donald Trump's plan for Ukraine involves territorial concessions to Russia.
The plan also proposes limiting the size of Ukraine's military.
The plan has caused alarm in Kyiv and across Europe.
The plan requires Ukraine to stay out of NATO.
The plan is presented as a peace proposal.

items.standfirst: Students taken from Catholic school in Niger state amid threats from Trump to intervene over ‘Christian genocide’Unknown gunmen have abducted an unidentified number of students from a Catholic school in central Nigeria, the second mass abduction in the country in a week.The latest kidnapping, in Papiri community in Niger state, came against the backdrop of Donald Trump’s threat to intervene militarily to end a “Christian genocide”, which the Nigerian government has denied is happening. Continue reading...

items.title: Gunmen kidnap more than 200 students from school in Nigeria
items.standfirst: Over 200 students have been kidnapped from a Catholic boarding school in western Nigeria - the second mass abduction in the country this week.
items.content: Over 200 students have been kidnapped from a Catholic boarding school in western Nigeria - the second mass abduction in the country this week.

ai_summary: Gunmen abducted students from a Catholic school in Nigeria.
This is the second mass abduction in Nigeria within a week.
The latest kidnapping occurred in Niger state.
The abductions follow threats from Trump to intervene.
Residents fear nearly 100 students and staff were taken.

items.title: France will investigate Musk’s Grok after AI chatbot posted Holocaust denial claims
items.standfirst: France’s government is taking action against billionaire Elon Musk 's artificial intelligence chatbot Grok after it generated French-language posts that questioned the use of gas chambers at Auschwitz, officials said.
items.content: France’s government is taking action against billionaire Elon Musk 's artificial intelligence chatbot Grok after it generated French-language posts that questioned the use of gas chambers at Auschwitz, officials said.

clusters.title: Democrats investigating Epstein decry Andrew ‘silence’ over interview request
clusters.neutral_headline: Democrats investigating Epstein decry Andrew ‘silence’ over interview request

items.title: Democrats investigating Epstein decry Andrew ‘silence’ over interview request
items.standfirst: Mountbatten-Windsor ‘continues to hide’, US lawmakers say, after deadline they set to receive response passesTwo Democratic lawmakers involved in the US congressional investigation into the disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein on Friday condemned Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor’s “silence” in response to their request that he sit for a deposition.Robert Garcia, the ranking member of the House oversight committee, and Suhas Subramanyam, a member of the panel, were among the Democrats who earlier this month sent the former British prince a letter seeking his cooperation in their inquiry into Epstein, who died in 2019 while awaiting trial on sex-trafficking charges. Continue reading...
items.content: Mountbatten-Windsor ‘continues to hide’, US lawmakers say, after deadline they set to receive response passesTwo Democratic lawmakers involved in the US congressional investigation into the disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein on Friday condemned Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor’s “silence” in response to their request that he sit for a deposition.Robert Garcia, the ranking member of the House oversight committee, and Suhas Subramanyam, a member of the panel, were among the Democrats who earlier this month sent the former British prince a letter seeking his cooperation in their inquiry into Epstein, who died in 2019 while awaiting trial on sex-trafficking charges. Continue reading...

items.title: Larry Summers to relinquish Harvard teaching role amid Epstein inquiry
items.standfirst: Decision comes after ex-treasury secretary said he would step back from public commitments over links to EpsteinLarry Summers, the former president of Harvard University, will stop teaching at the school while it investigates his connection to the disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein, a spokesman for Summers said on Wednesday.Emails recently released by the US House oversight committee reignited questions about Summers’ relationship with Epstein, who died in jail in 2019 while awaiting trial on federal charges of sex-trafficking minors. Many of the messages indicated a friendship that lasted well into 2019. Contact only ceased shortly before Epstein was arrested in July of that same year. Continue reading...
items.content: Decision comes after ex-treasury secretary said he would step back from public commitments over links to EpsteinLarry Summers, the former president of Harvard University, will stop teaching at the school while it investigates his connection to the disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein, a spokesman for Summers said on Wednesday.Emails recently released by the US House oversight committee reignited questions about Summers’ relationship with Epstein, who died in jail in 2019 while awaiting trial on federal charges of sex-trafficking minors. Many of the messages indicated a friendship that lasted well into 2019. Contact only ceased shortly before Epstein was arrested in July of that same year. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Democrats are investigating Jeffrey Epstein.
They are criticizing Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's silence.
Lawmakers requested an interview with Andrew.
Larry Summers will relinquish his Harvard teaching role.
Summers is connected to the Epstein inquiry.

clusters.title: US government to nix October inflation report after history-making shutdown
clusters.neutral_headline: US Cancels October Inflation Report Due to Shutdown

items.title: US government to nix October inflation report after history-making shutdown
items.standfirst: The Bureau of Labor Statistics has explained it was 'unable to retroactively collect' the data on consumer prices.
items.content: The Bureau of Labor Statistics has explained it was 'unable to retroactively collect' the data on consumer prices.

items.title: US data agency cancels October inflation report as Fed considers whether to cut rates
items.standfirst: Bureau of Labor Statistics canceled release of October’s consumer price index, citing the government shutdownThe US federal government will not publish official data on inflation for October, depriving policymakers at the Federal Reserve of key information as they consider whether to cut interest rates.The Bureau of Labor Statistics canceled the release of the closely watched consumer price index (CPI) for October, citing the government shutdown – the longest in history, before it ended earlier this month – and stating it could not “retroactively collect” the data required for the report. Continue reading...
items.content: Bureau of Labor Statistics canceled release of October’s consumer price index, citing the government shutdownThe US federal government will not publish official data on inflation for October, depriving policymakers at the Federal Reserve of key information as they consider whether to cut interest rates.The Bureau of Labor Statistics canceled the release of the closely watched consumer price index (CPI) for October, citing the government shutdown – the longest in history, before it ended earlier this month – and stating it could not “retroactively collect” the data required for the report. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The Bureau of Labor Statistics could not collect data retroactively for the report.
The government shutdown prevented the collection of necessary consumer price data.
The Federal Reserve will lack key inflation information for policy decisions.
The shutdown was the longest in US history before ending earlier this month.
The CPI report release was canceled due to the government's inability to gather data.
